Vix Form Design

A form is an area with inputs in it. This means it has Collection of inputs, Text Inputs, Choice inputs, Buttons and Validators etc.

Collections

A collection is a group of similar form inputs.

Fielset & Legend

Fieldset

A fieldset is a collection of similar input fields. Practical use example is in a contact form. There may be Identification Set, Address Set, Phone Set, Email Set etc.

Legend

Every fieldset has a legend, that is it's title.

An Example of fieldsets and legend is to be shown below:

May It be more practical to use fieldsets and legends as details and Summaries respectively, Yours to describe.

Text Fields

A text field is an area for users to type Information.

Placeholders

A placeholder is a prehint that occupies an input when it contains nothing. Placeholders show an example of the expected input, such as suggested search terms or a demonstration of a correctly formatted email address.

Label

A label is a sample of text that goes with an input to describe it. It show the type of Information to be typed into the input.

Floating Labels

A floating label is one that takes the place of a placeholder but become smaller and moves away when the Input is no longer blank.

Attachments

Attachments or accessories are other custom elements that go with a text input. It may be for validation or password strength or showing the password.

Prefixes and suffixes

Sometimes a field require words before it like an @ before a username or a Mr before a name. It may also require a suffix such as .com when registering a site. The prefixes may also be icons.

Underline

An underline is a type of line that appears at the bottom of an input when it is active.
